docs.text: Welcome to Gramophone Gramophone is an exploration of spotify's luigi using spotify's api data. This is also a DevOps exercise. Getting started Commands mkdocs new [dir-name] - Create a new project. mkdocs serve - Start the live-reloading docs server. mkdocs build - Build the documentation site. mkdocs -h - Print help message and exit.
docs.title: Introduction

docs.text: Gramophone is an exploration of spotify's luigi using spotify's api data. This is also a DevOps exercise.

docs.text: Documentation for say_hello Houses the say_hello example function. Source code in hello/world.py 4 5 6 7 8 9 10 class HelloWorld : """Houses the say_hello example function.""" @staticmethod def say_hello () -> None : """Print `Hello world!!`. Nothing else.""" print ( "Hello world!!" ) say_hello () staticmethod Print Hello world!! . Nothing else. docs.text: Contributing Contributions are very welcome. Tests can be run with tox, please ensure the coverage at least stays the same before you submit a pull request. Distributed under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license, "Gramophone" is free and open source software. If you encounter any problems, please file an issue along with a detailed description. Development set up Follow the instructions bellow to set up your development environment: (Optional) Install poetry as in the official docs . Clone the repository: git clone git@github.com:dbbvitor/gramophone-spotify-pipeline.git Install this project dependencies: poetry install Set up the pre-commit hooks pre-commit install Code away!
docs.title: Contributing
